content: @pnkfelix @Wesley Wiser @apiraino I've been having some discussions with folks on core/the foundation/etc. about some of the various legal questions the project needs to wrestle with (e.g., the Nintendo Switch target), and one thing came to my mind was adding a small prompt in the compiler triage meeting to encourage anyone who has seen anything that _might_ pose legal questions to bring it up so that it can be brought to the attention of the foundation legal team. This would encourage a "when in doubt, report" type mentality. Any thoughts?
+1 from me. Seems like it could be part of the announcements section at the start of the meeting potentially.
sure, I’m good with that being on the template.
Though should such questions be raised in the publically posted meeting, or should they be privately sent?

I think the idea would just be flagging public things are being potentially relevant from a legal perspective. There wouldn't be any discussion on the actual matter itself, that would all happen in an email to the foundation
In a sense this is sort of a top of the funnel and is just meant for encouraging items to be brought to the attention of legal

I understand the concern and totally agree with including it in the "Announcements" or in any section that fits the topic. I was even thinking that a I-nominate flag could do the job to bring this to the T-compiler attention and then be forwarded to whom it may concern.
shoot, I forgot to state this reminder at yesteday’s meeting. @apiraino , when you get a chance, can you add it to the templat e that drives the agenda generation each week?
ok, will do. And perhaps then I will ask for a review of the wording, i'm not 100% about it :-)

ok added in the "Announcements"
https://hackmd.io/WQW0yzDDS16YvtBNurmj6A?view

Is it ok to frame this specifically to "compiler targets legal questions" or more generically "legal questions about ..."?
I think its broader than compiler targets
e.g. we’d want to remind people to get support if they have questions about copyright
(which is an existing/on-going concern; see e.g. #63232 )
